description: Kick off your weekend with hill country vibes at Vista Brewing’s Driftwood Nights, a laid-back outdoor songwriter series that’s perfect for the whole family.  Fridays are also Steak Night, featuring rotating chef-curated specials (think grilled ribeye with seasonal sides).

activity_name: Second Saturdays Are for Families@ Laguna Gloria

description: This weekend’sMirror, Mirroredition of Laguna Gloria’s Second Saturdays invites kids to explore reflective art through hands-on activities like mirrored collages and shiny sculptures.  Most activities take place outdoors, so pack hats, water bottles, and maybe an umbrella, just in case! RSVPhere.

description: Step into a vibrant anime universe at this all-ages celebration packed with cosplay contests (yes, there’s a kids’ category!), Chibi artist booths, themed activities, and loads of arcade fun.  Families can explore vendor tables, win raffle prizes, and enjoy kid-approved eats from Mikki’s Tavern.
raw_datetime: Sunday, July 12 | 4 pm – 9 pm (changes to 18+ at 9 pm | Entrance is FREE

description:
Celebrate the legacy of Bob Bullock—Texas’s former Lieutenant Governor and the driving force behind the Bullock Museum—with a birthday bash the whole family can enjoy! This free event features:
It’s a fun way to explore Texas history, cool off indoors, and make some sweet memories with the kids.  Get all the info and full schedulehere.
raw_datetime: Sunday, July 13 | Kids’ activities from 10 am – 2 pm | FREE

description: This summer, Thinkery is keeping weekends fresh with STEAM Sundays—a five-week series where each Sunday is all about one of the five STEAM topics: Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math.  Expect hands-on activities, themed storytimes, and lots of creative ways for kids to learn while they play.
raw_datetime: Sunday, July 12 | 10 am – 5 pm | Included with GAhere

description: Spend a summer Sunday surrounded by art and nature at UMLAUF’s Family Day! Kids can get creative with hands-on watercolor crafts, explore interactive stations hosted by local nature groups, and take part in water-themed conservation activities.  Storytime with Meredith Wilson happens at 12:30 and 1:30 pm, and there are outdoor games and art scavenger hunts to keep the whole family entertained.
